title: Mount Darwin (California)
text:
Mount Darwin is a flat-topped <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="Sierra%20Nevada%20%28U.S.%29">Sierra Nevada</a>, on the border of between <a href="Fresno%20County%2C%20California">Fresno</a> and <a href="Inyo%20County%2C%20California">Inyo</a> counties in <a href="Kings%20Canyon%20National%20Park">Kings Canyon National Park</a> and the <a href="John%20Muir%20Wilderness">John Muir Wilderness</a> of <a href="California">California</a>.
History.
Two <a href="Australia">Australia</a>n geologists, <a href="Ernest%20Clayton%20Andrews">Ernest Clayton Andrews</a> and Willard D. Johnson, made the first recorded ascent on August 12, 1908.
The modern name of the mountain was given to it in 1895 by <a href="Theodore%20S.%20Solomons">Theodore S. Solomons</a> and E. C. Bonner of the <a href="United%20States%20Geological%20Survey">United States Geological Survey</a> as part of a series of mountains named for the six major exponents of the theory of <a href="evolution">evolution</a>. Mount Darwin is named for the naturalist, <a href="Charles%20Darwin">Charles Darwin</a>. Other nearby mountains in the Evolution Group include <a href="Mount%20Mendel">Mount Mendel</a>, <a href="Mount%20Fiske">Mount Fiske</a>, <a href="Mount%20Haeckel">Mount Haeckel</a>, <a href="Mount%20Huxley%20%28California%29">Mount Huxley</a>, <a href="Mount%20Spencer%20%28California%29">Mount Spencer</a>, <a href="Mount%20Wallace%20%28Fresno%20and%20Inyo%20counties%2C%20California%29">Mount Wallace</a>, and <a href="Mount%20Lamarck">Mount Lamarck</a>. The area around the peaks, known as the Evolution Region, includes Evolution Basin and Evolution Valley.
Nearby landmarks include <a href="Darwin%20Glacier%20%28California%29">Darwin Glacier</a> and Darwin Canyon.
A similar exercise in naming mountains after naturalists and other late nineteenth century proponents of evolution theory was carried out at the <a href="West%20Coast%20Range">West Coast Range</a> in <a href="Tasmania">Tasmania</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. In contrast, <a href="Mount%20Darwin%20%28Andes%29">Mount Darwin</a> in <a href="Tierra%20del%20Fuego">Tierra del Fuego</a> was given its name during <a href="Second%20voyage%20of%20HMS%20Beagle">the voyage of the "Beagle"</a> by captain <a href="Robert%20FitzRoy">Robert FitzRoy</a> to celebrate Darwin's 25th birthday on 12 February 1834.
